short-title.#text:
Travel Reimbursement for Inactive Duty
			 Training Personnel (TRIP) Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Travel and
			 transportation allowances for members of the reserve components for long
			 distance and certain other travel to inactive duty training

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chapter 8 of title
			 37, United States Code

header.#text:
Travel and
				transportation allowances: long distance and certain other travel to inactive
				duty training performed by members of the reserve components of the armed
				forces

text.#text:
The Secretary concerned shall reimburse a member of a
				reserve component of the armed forces for transportation expenses, including
				mileage traveled, incurred in connection with the following:

Round-trip travel
				in excess of 100 miles to an inactive duty training location, regardless of the
				method of transportation.

Round-trip travel
				of any distance to an inactive duty training location, if such travel requires
				a commercial method of transportation other than ground transportation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the Secretary concerned shall use the mileage
				reimbursement rate for the use of privately owned vehicles by Government
				employees on official business (when a Government vehicle is available), as
				prescribed by the

text.#text:
In
				determining the amount of allowances or reimbursement to be paid for mileage
				traveled under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for travel covered by that subsection shall be the
				reasonable commercial fare expense for such travel by common carrier.

text.#text:
The amount of reimbursement to be
				paid under

header.#text:
Commercial fare
				for travel by common carrier

text.#text:
The
				Secretary concerned shall prescribe regulations to carry out this section.
				Regulations prescribed by the Secretary of a military department shall be
				subject to the approval of the

No
				reimbursement may be provided under this section for travel that begins after
				the travel authorities transition expiration
				date.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by inserting after the item relating to

text.#text: The table of sections at the beginning of

toc-entry.#text:
478b. Travel and transportation allowances: long distance and
				certain other travel to inactive duty training performed by members of the
				reserve components of the armed
				forces.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply with respect to travel expenses incurred after the
			 expiration of the 90-day period that begins on the date of the enactment of
			 this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Travel Reimbursement for Inactive Duty Training Personnel (TRIP) Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 37, United States Code, to provide travel
		  and transportation allowances for members of the reserve components for long
		  distance and certain other travel to inactive duty training.
